description: These objects allow you to create vector geometry programmatically within Lua scripts.

classes.name: Contour
classes.documentation: Represents a vector contour (path) consisting of one or more spans (lines, arcs, or beziers).

constructors.label: Contour(tolerance: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new empty contour with the specified tolerance.

properties.name: IsClosed
properties.documentation: True if the contour is closed

properties.name: IsClockwise
properties.documentation: True if the contour is wound clockwise

methods.name: AppendPoint
methods.documentation: Start a new contour or append a line

methods.name: ArcTo
methods.detail: (end_pt2d: Point2D, center_pt2d: Point2D, ccw: boolean) → boolean

signature.label: ArcTo(end_pt2d: Point2D, center_pt2d: Point2D, ccw: boolean)

methods.name: Clone
methods.documentation: Return a copy of this contour

properties.name: Count
properties.documentation: Number of contours in the group

properties.name: IsEmpty
properties.documentation: True if the group contains no contours

methods.name: AddHead
methods.documentation: Add a contour to the head

signature.label: AddHead(ctr: Contour)
signature.documentation: Add a contour to the head

methods.name: AddTail
methods.documentation: Add a contour to the tail

signature.label: AddTail(ctr: Contour)
signature.documentation: Add a contour to the tail
